alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 26 at 11:58AM MST until December 27 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Lewis and Clark and Teton Counties, including the Southern Rocky Mountain Front, and Cascade. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Occasional light snow showers remain possible through the afternoon.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
